subject: p14312560
History: Year old man with intubation and lines, trip to OR, tube lines drain placement tube lines drain placement.
Impression: Mild cardiomegaly has worsened since :14 accompanied by increasing pulmonary vascular engorgement, indicating greater intravascular volume or mild biventricular heart failure is developing. Right infrahilar consolidation consistent with pneumonia is unchanged. ET tube in standard placement. Swan-Ganz catheter ends in the main pulmonary artery, right jugular introducer ends in the upper SVC, and a nasogastric tube ending in the upper stomach would need to be advanced at least 8 cm to move all the side ports below the diaphragm.
